definition: not to have room to put sth/to be unable to let go
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
(negative prefix)/not/no
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
cannot stop worrying

sentences.english: He never dwelled on a hit.
sentences.chinese: 他从来不会总是放不下某次碰撞。

sentences.english: Allows you to ask, because every mother always keep their children.
sentences.chinese: 请你允许，因为每一个母亲都总放不下自己的孩子。

sentences.english: Our school are so small, even can't get in a pommelled horse.
sentences.chinese: 我们的校园很小，放不下一个鞍马。

sentences.english: Please ship the remaining products as soon as possible, because the factory has no more space now.
sentences.chinese: 请尽快安排剩余产品出货，现在工厂已经放不下了。

sentences.english: I live to this age, starting to get something fit only chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 我活到这把年纪，拿的起放不下的东西只有筷子。

sentences.english: The English houses were too small to get everyone inside.
sentences.chinese: 英国人的房子太小了根本放不下所有的人。

sentences.english: I decided to first try the "Whiskas Temptations Salmon Flavored Treats.
sentences.chinese: 我决定先试试“好吃放不下”的鲑鱼味点心。

sentences.english: But that bedroom is so small. We’d never be able to fit all of our stuff in there.
sentences.chinese: 但是卧室那么小，放不下我们的东西。

sentences.english: Quarto volumes are too large to fit on this shelf.
sentences.chinese: 这架子上放不下四开本的书。

sentences.english: This television cabinet is too small for this new television.
sentences.chinese: 这个电视柜太小，已经放不下这台新电视了。

sentences.english: You led my hand, can not let go will never let you go.
sentences.chinese: 你拉着我的手，放不下，永远不会让你走开。

sentences.english: I decided to first try the "Whiskas Temptations Salmon Flavored Treats."
sentences.chinese: 我决定先试试“好吃放不下”的鲑鱼味点心。

sentences.english: The problem is you're just not good at letting go.
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，你总是拿得起放不下。

sentences.english: You can"t forgey love and pride."
sentences.chinese: 你放不下曾经的爱和荣耀。

sentences.english: Ep680 - Kexin still misses her late father very much. She performs badly at work.
sentences.chinese: 可欣仍放不下对亡父四川的思念，工作错漏百出。

sentences.english: I admit that I am a bad kid who can't afford to let go.
sentences.chinese: 我承认我就是一个拿得起放不下的坏孩子。

definition: to be able to accomodate/to have room for/to be able to put (sth) down
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to give up/to part with
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
to keep in mind constantly (idiom)
cannot forget
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
see 懷舊|怀旧[huai2 jiu4]
to love dearly
to remember old friends/to cherish old friendships/for old time's sake
to miss/to remember with longing/to long to see again
seeing an object makes one miss its owner (idiom)
to think of/to keep thinking about/to be concerned about
empty/desolate
